lines.gurmukhi: srvn syvw kInI mwqw ipqw kI ibsyK qw qy gweIAq js jgq mY qwhU ko
lines.transliteration_english: Saravan Sayvaa Keenee Maataa Pitaa Kee Bisaykha , Taa Tay Gaaeeat Jas Jagat Mai Taahoo Ko ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Sarwan, the devoted son served his blind parents with love and dedication that has earned him fame and praise in the world.

lines.gurmukhi: jn pHlwid Awid AMq lau AivigAw kInI qwq Gwq kir pRB rwiKE pRnu vwhU ko
lines.transliteration_english: Jan Prahalaadi Aadi Ant Lau Avigiaa Keenee , Taat Ghaat Kari Prabh Raakhiao Pranu Vaahoo Ko ?

Shabad OS B.translation: What a strange play it is of the Lord that instead of serving his father, Bhagat Prahlad disobeyed his father's order that demanded of him not to meditate on the name of God (Ram). The Lord destroyed Harnakash (Prahlad's father) and protected Prahlad thus

lines.gurmukhi: duAwds brK suk jnnI duKq krI isD Bey qqiKn jnmu hY jwhU ko
lines.transliteration_english: Duaadas Barakh Souk Jananee Doukhat Karee , Sidh Bhaay Tatakhin Janamu Hai Jaahoo Ko ?

Shabad OS B.translation: It is said that sage Sukdev kept on causing pain to his mother by remaining in her womb for 12 years, but when born he was found to be an established and perfect sage, and all those born at that time turned out to be hermit with divine powers.

lines.gurmukhi: AkQ kQw ibsm jwnIAY n jwie kCu phucY n igAwn aunmwnu Awn kwhU ko ]436]
lines.transliteration_english: Akad Kadaa Bisam Jaaneeai N Jaai Kachhu , Pahouchai N Giaan Ounamaanu Aan Kaahoo Ko ?436?

Shabad OS B.translation: His mysterious play is beyond explanation and is astonishing. No one can know on whom will He be kind when and where and who will receive His blessings.  (436)
